interfaces.core.data_types¶

Source: src\interfaces\core\data_types.py

Module Overview¶

Core data types for communication framework.

This module defines standardized data structures used throughout the communication framework, providing type safety and consistent interfaces for configuration, monitoring, and data exchange.

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#========================= src/interfaces/core/data_types.py ==========================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Core data types for communication framework.
  7
  8This module defines standardized data structures used throughout the
  9communication framework, providing type safety and consistent interfaces
 10for configuration, monitoring, and data exchange.
 11"""
 12
 13from __future__ import annotations
 14
 15from dataclasses import dataclass, field
 16from typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional, Tuple
 17from enum import Enum
 18import time
 19import uuid
 20
 21
 22class InterfaceType(Enum):
 23    """Interface type enumeration."""
 24    UDP = "udp"
 25    TCP = "tcp"
 26    HTTP = "http"
 27    WEBSOCKET = "websocket"
 28    SERIAL = "serial"
 29    MODBUS = "modbus"
 30    ETHERCAT = "ethercat"
 31    GRPC = "grpc"
 32    MQTT = "mqtt"
 33    ZEROMQ = "zeromq"
 34    FILE = "file"
 35    DATABASE = "database"
 36
 37
 38class TransportType(Enum):
 39    """Transport layer type."""
 40    RELIABLE = "reliable"      # TCP-like guarantees
 41    UNRELIABLE = "unreliable"  # UDP-like best effort
 42    STREAM = "stream"          # Continuous data flow
 43    DATAGRAM = "datagram"      # Discrete messages
 44
 45
 46class SecurityLevel(Enum):
 47    """Security level enumeration."""
 48    NONE = "none"
 49    BASIC = "basic"
 50    ENCRYPTED = "encrypted"
 51    AUTHENTICATED = "authenticated"
 52    MUTUAL_TLS = "mutual_tls"
 53
 54
 55@dataclass
 56class Message:
 57    """Standard message structure for all communications."""
 58
 59    # Message identification
 60    message_id: str = field(default_factory=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()))
 61    correlation_id: Optional[str] = None
 62    timestamp: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
 63
 64    # Message routing
 65    source: str = "unknown"
 66    destination: Optional[str] = None
 67    reply_to: Optional[str] = None
 68
 69    # Message content
 70    message_type: str = "data"
 71    payload: Any = None
 72    headers: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 73
 74    # Message properties
 75    priority: int = 2  # 1=low, 2=normal, 3=high, 4=critical
 76    ttl: Optional[float] = None  # Time to live in seconds
 77    compression: Optional[str] = None
 78    encryption: Optional[str] = None
 79
 80    # Delivery tracking
 81    retry_count: int = 0
 82    max_retries: int = 3
 83    delivery_attempts: List[float] = field(default_factory=list)
 84
 85    def __post_init__(self):
 86        """Initialize delivery tracking."""
 87        if not self.delivery_attempts:
 88            self.delivery_attempts.append(self.timestamp)
 89
 90    @property
 91    def is_expired(self) -> bool:
 92        """Check if message has expired."""
 93        if self.ttl is None:
 94            return False
 95        return time.time() > (self.timestamp + self.ttl)
 96
 97    @property
 98    def age(self) -> float:
 99        """Get message age in seconds."""
100        return time.time() - self.timestamp
101
102    def add_header(self, key: str, value: Any) -> None:
103        """Add header to message."""
104        self.headers[key] = value
105
106    def get_header(self, key: str, default: Any = None) -> Any:
107        """Get header value."""
108        return self.headers.get(key, default)
109
110
111@dataclass
112class ConnectionInfo:
113    """Connection information and status."""
114
115    # Connection identification
116    connection_id: str = field(default_factory=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()))
117    endpoint: str = "unknown"
118    interface_type: InterfaceType = InterfaceType.TCP
119
120    # Connection state
121    state: str = "disconnected"
122    connected_at: Optional[float] = None
123    disconnected_at: Optional[float] = None
124    last_activity: Optional[float] = None
125
126    # Connection properties
127    local_address: Optional[Tuple[str, int]] = None
128    remote_address: Optional[Tuple[str, int]] = None
129    transport_type: TransportType = TransportType.RELIABLE
130    security_level: SecurityLevel = SecurityLevel.NONE
131
132    # Connection metrics
133    bytes_sent: int = 0
134    bytes_received: int = 0
135    messages_sent: int = 0
136    messages_received: int = 0
137    errors: int = 0
138    reconnections: int = 0
139
140    # Connection configuration
141    config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
142    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
143
144    @property
145    def is_connected(self) -> bool:
146        """Check if connection is active."""
147        return self.state == "connected"
148
149    @property
150    def connection_duration(self) -> Optional[float]:
151        """Get connection duration in seconds."""
152        if self.connected_at is None:
153            return None
154        end_time = self.disconnected_at or time.time()
155        return end_time - self.connected_at
156
157    @property
158    def idle_time(self) -> Optional[float]:
159        """Get idle time since last activity."""
160        if self.last_activity is None:
161            return None
162        return time.time() - self.last_activity
163
164    def update_activity(self) -> None:
165        """Update last activity timestamp."""
166        self.last_activity = time.time()
167
168
169@dataclass
170class InterfaceConfig:
171    """Configuration for communication interfaces."""
172
173    # Interface identification
174    name: str = "default"
175    interface_type: InterfaceType = InterfaceType.TCP
176    description: str = ""
177
178    # Connection settings
179    endpoint: str = "localhost:8080"
180    timeout: float = 30.0
181    retry_attempts: int = 3
182    retry_delay: float = 1.0
183    keep_alive: bool = True
184
185    # Buffer settings
186    send_buffer_size: int = 8192
187    receive_buffer_size: int = 8192
188    max_message_size: int = 1024 * 1024  # 1MB
189
190    # Security settings
191    security_level: SecurityLevel = SecurityLevel.NONE
192    ssl_cert_path: Optional[str] = None
193    ssl_key_path: Optional[str] = None
194    auth_token: Optional[str] = None
195
196    # Protocol settings
197    serialization: str = "json"
198    compression: Optional[str] = None
199    encoding: str = "utf-8"
200
201    # Quality of Service
202    message_ordering: bool = False
203    duplicate_detection: bool = False
204    delivery_confirmation: bool = False
205
206    # Monitoring
207    enable_metrics: bool = True
208    enable_logging: bool = True
209    log_level: str = "INFO"
210
211    # Custom settings
212    custom_settings: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
213
214    def get_setting(self, key: str, default: Any = None) -> Any:
215        """Get custom setting value."""
216        return self.custom_settings.get(key, default)
217
218    def set_setting(self, key: str, value: Any) -> None:
219        """Set custom setting value."""
220        self.custom_settings[key] = value
221
222
223@dataclass
224class ErrorInfo:
225    """Error information for diagnostics."""
226
227    # Error identification
228    error_id: str = field(default_factory=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()))
229    timestamp: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
230
231    # Error details
232    error_type: str = "unknown"
233    error_code: Optional[str] = None
234    message: str = ""
235    details: Optional[str] = None
236
237    # Error context
238    component: str = "unknown"
239    operation: Optional[str] = None
240    connection_id: Optional[str] = None
241    message_id: Optional[str] = None
242
243    # Error classification
244    severity: str = "error"  # debug, info, warning, error, critical
245    category: str = "communication"  # communication, configuration, hardware, etc.
246    recoverable: bool = True
247
248    # Error tracking
249    retry_count: int = 0
250    related_errors: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
251    resolution: Optional[str] = None
252
253    # Additional data
254    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
255
256    @property
257    def age(self) -> float:
258        """Get error age in seconds."""
259        return time.time() - self.timestamp
260
261    def add_related_error(self, error_id: str) -> None:
262        """Add related error ID."""
263        if error_id not in self.related_errors:
264            self.related_errors.append(error_id)
265
266
267@dataclass
268class PerformanceMetrics:
269    """Performance metrics for interfaces."""
270
271    # Timing metrics
272    latency_min: float = float('inf')
273    latency_max: float = 0.0
274    latency_avg: float = 0.0
275    latency_p95: float = 0.0
276    latency_p99: float = 0.0
277
278    # Throughput metrics
279    messages_per_second: float = 0.0
280    bytes_per_second: float = 0.0
281    operations_per_second: float = 0.0
282
283    # Reliability metrics
284    success_rate: float = 0.0
285    error_rate: float = 0.0
286    timeout_rate: float = 0.0
287    retry_rate: float = 0.0
288
289    # Resource metrics
290    cpu_usage: float = 0.0
291    memory_usage: float = 0.0
292    network_usage: float = 0.0
293    connection_count: int = 0
294
295    # Queue metrics
296    queue_depth: int = 0
297    queue_latency: float = 0.0
298    dropped_messages: int = 0
299    backpressure_events: int = 0
300
301    # Time window
302    measurement_start: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
303    measurement_end: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
304    sample_count: int = 0
305
306    @property
307    def measurement_duration(self) -> float:
308        """Get measurement duration in seconds."""
309        return self.measurement_end - self.measurement_start
310
311    def update_latency(self, latency: float) -> None:
312        """Update latency metrics with new sample."""
313        self.latency_min = min(self.latency_min, latency)
314        self.latency_max = max(self.latency_max, latency)
315
316        # Update running average
317        self.latency_avg = ((self.latency_avg * self.sample_count + latency) /
318                           (self.sample_count + 1))
319        self.sample_count += 1
320
321
322@dataclass
323class CommunicationStats:
324    """Comprehensive communication statistics."""
325
326    # Basic counters
327    total_connections: int = 0
328    active_connections: int = 0
329    failed_connections: int = 0
330
331    # Message counters
332    messages_sent: int = 0
333    messages_received: int = 0
334    messages_dropped: int = 0
335    messages_retried: int = 0
336
337    # Byte counters
338    bytes_sent: int = 0
339    bytes_received: int = 0
340
341    # Error counters
342    connection_errors: int = 0
343    timeout_errors: int = 0
344    serialization_errors: int = 0
345    protocol_errors: int = 0
346
347    # Performance metrics
348    performance: PerformanceMetrics = field(default_factory=PerformanceMetrics)
349
350    # Historical data
351    hourly_stats: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
352    daily_stats: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
353
354    # Status tracking
355    last_reset: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
356    last_update: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
357
358    def reset_counters(self) -> None:
359        """Reset all counters."""
360        self.total_connections = 0
361        self.active_connections = 0
362        self.failed_connections = 0
363        self.messages_sent = 0
364        self.messages_received = 0
365        self.messages_dropped = 0
366        self.messages_retried = 0
367        self.bytes_sent = 0
368        self.bytes_received = 0
369        self.connection_errors = 0
370        self.timeout_errors = 0
371        self.serialization_errors = 0
372        self.protocol_errors = 0
373        self.last_reset = time.time()
374
375    def update_timestamp(self) -> None:
376        """Update last update timestamp."""
377        self.last_update = time.time()
378
379    @property
380    def uptime(self) -> float:
381        """Get uptime since last reset in seconds."""
382        return time.time() - self.last_reset
383
384
385@dataclass
386class QueueConfig:
387    """Configuration for message queues."""
388
389    # Queue properties
390    max_size: int = 1000
391    timeout: float = 30.0
392    priority_enabled: bool = False
393
394    # Overflow behavior
395    overflow_strategy: str = "drop_oldest"  # drop_oldest, drop_newest, block, reject
396
397    # Persistence
398    persistent: bool = False
399    persistence_file: Optional[str] = None
400
401    # Monitoring
402    enable_metrics: bool = True
403    warning_threshold: float = 0.8  # Warn when queue is 80% full
404
405    # Serialization
406    serializer: str = "pickle"
407
408    def get_warning_size(self) -> int:
409        """Get queue size that triggers warning."""
410        return int(self.max_size * self.warning_threshold)
411
412
413@dataclass
414class DeviceInfo:
415    """Device information structure."""
416
417    # Device identification
418    device_id: str = field(default_factory=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()))
419    name: str = "unknown"
420    manufacturer: str = "unknown"
421    model: str = "unknown"
422    serial_number: Optional[str] = None
423    firmware_version: Optional[str] = None
424
425    # Device properties
426    device_type: str = "generic"
427    capabilities: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
428    supported_protocols: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
429
430    # Connection info
431    interface_type: InterfaceType = InterfaceType.SERIAL
432    address: Optional[str] = None
433    baudrate: Optional[int] = None
434
435    # Status
436    online: bool = False
437    last_seen: Optional[float] = None
438    health_status: str = "unknown"
439
440    # Configuration
441    config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
442    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
443
444    @property
445    def is_online(self) -> bool:
446        """Check if device is online."""
447        return self.online
448
449    @property
450    def time_since_seen(self) -> Optional[float]:
451        """Get time since last seen in seconds."""
452        if self.last_seen is None:
453            return None
454        return time.time() - self.last_seen
455
456    def update_last_seen(self) -> None:
457        """Update last seen timestamp."""
458        self.last_seen = time.time()
459        self.online = True

Message¶

Standard message structure for all communications.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class Message:
 3    """Standard message structure for all communications."""
 4
 5    # Message identification
 6    message_id: str = field(default_factory=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()))
 7    correlation_id: Optional[str] = None
 8    timestamp: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
 9
10    # Message routing
11    source: str = "unknown"
12    destination: Optional[str] = None
13    reply_to: Optional[str] = None
14
15    # Message content
16    message_type: str = "data"
17    payload: Any = None
18    headers: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
19
20    # Message properties
21    priority: int = 2  # 1=low, 2=normal, 3=high, 4=critical
22    ttl: Optional[float] = None  # Time to live in seconds
23    compression: Optional[str] = None
24    encryption: Optional[str] = None
25
26    # Delivery tracking
27    retry_count: int = 0
28    max_retries: int = 3
29    delivery_attempts: List[float] = field(default_factory=list)
30
31    def __post_init__(self):
32        """Initialize delivery tracking."""
33        if not self.delivery_attempts:
34            self.delivery_attempts.append(self.timestamp)
35
36    @property
37    def is_expired(self) -> bool:
38        """Check if message has expired."""
39        if self.ttl is None:
40            return False
41        return time.time() > (self.timestamp + self.ttl)
42
43    @property
44    def age(self) -> float:
45        """Get message age in seconds."""
46        return time.time() - self.timestamp
47
48    def add_header(self, key: str, value: Any) -> None:
49        """Add header to message."""
50        self.headers[key] = value
51
52    def get_header(self, key: str, default: Any = None) -> Any:
53        """Get header value."""
54        return self.headers.get(key, default)

ConnectionInfo¶

Connection information and status.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class ConnectionInfo:
 3    """Connection information and status."""
 4
 5    # Connection identification
 6    connection_id: str = field(default_factory=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()))
 7    endpoint: str = "unknown"
 8    interface_type: InterfaceType = InterfaceType.TCP
 9
10    # Connection state
11    state: str = "disconnected"
12    connected_at: Optional[float] = None
13    disconnected_at: Optional[float] = None
14    last_activity: Optional[float] = None
15
16    # Connection properties
17    local_address: Optional[Tuple[str, int]] = None
18    remote_address: Optional[Tuple[str, int]] = None
19    transport_type: TransportType = TransportType.RELIABLE
20    security_level: SecurityLevel = SecurityLevel.NONE
21
22    # Connection metrics
23    bytes_sent: int = 0
24    bytes_received: int = 0
25    messages_sent: int = 0
26    messages_received: int = 0
27    errors: int = 0
28    reconnections: int = 0
29
30    # Connection configuration
31    config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
32    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
33
34    @property
35    def is_connected(self) -> bool:
36        """Check if connection is active."""
37        return self.state == "connected"
38
39    @property
40    def connection_duration(self) -> Optional[float]:
41        """Get connection duration in seconds."""
42        if self.connected_at is None:
43            return None
44        end_time = self.disconnected_at or time.time()
45        return end_time - self.connected_at
46
47    @property
48    def idle_time(self) -> Optional[float]:
49        """Get idle time since last activity."""
50        if self.last_activity is None:
51            return None
52        return time.time() - self.last_activity
53
54    def update_activity(self) -> None:
55        """Update last activity timestamp."""
56        self.last_activity = time.time()

 1@dataclass
 2class InterfaceConfig:
 3    """Configuration for communication interfaces."""
 4
 5    # Interface identification
 6    name: str = "default"
 7    interface_type: InterfaceType = InterfaceType.TCP
 8    description: str = ""
 9
10    # Connection settings
11    endpoint: str = "localhost:8080"
12    timeout: float = 30.0
13    retry_attempts: int = 3
14    retry_delay: float = 1.0
15    keep_alive: bool = True
16
17    # Buffer settings
18    send_buffer_size: int = 8192
19    receive_buffer_size: int = 8192
20    max_message_size: int = 1024 * 1024  # 1MB
21
22    # Security settings
23    security_level: SecurityLevel = SecurityLevel.NONE
24    ssl_cert_path: Optional[str] = None
25    ssl_key_path: Optional[str] = None
26    auth_token: Optional[str] = None
27
28    # Protocol settings
29    serialization: str = "json"
30    compression: Optional[str] = None
31    encoding: str = "utf-8"
32
33    # Quality of Service
34    message_ordering: bool = False
35    duplicate_detection: bool = False
36    delivery_confirmation: bool = False
37
38    # Monitoring
39    enable_metrics: bool = True
40    enable_logging: bool = True
41    log_level: str = "INFO"
42
43    # Custom settings
44    custom_settings: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
45
46    def get_setting(self, key: str, default: Any = None) -> Any:
47        """Get custom setting value."""
48        return self.custom_settings.get(key, default)
49
50    def set_setting(self, key: str, value: Any) -> None:
51        """Set custom setting value."""
52        self.custom_settings[key] = value

ErrorInfo¶

Error information for diagnostics.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class ErrorInfo:
 3    """Error information for diagnostics."""
 4
 5    # Error identification
 6    error_id: str = field(default_factory=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()))
 7    timestamp: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
 8
 9    # Error details
10    error_type: str = "unknown"
11    error_code: Optional[str] = None
12    message: str = ""
13    details: Optional[str] = None
14
15    # Error context
16    component: str = "unknown"
17    operation: Optional[str] = None
18    connection_id: Optional[str] = None
19    message_id: Optional[str] = None
20
21    # Error classification
22    severity: str = "error"  # debug, info, warning, error, critical
23    category: str = "communication"  # communication, configuration, hardware, etc.
24    recoverable: bool = True
25
26    # Error tracking
27    retry_count: int = 0
28    related_errors: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
29    resolution: Optional[str] = None
30
31    # Additional data
32    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
33
34    @property
35    def age(self) -> float:
36        """Get error age in seconds."""
37        return time.time() - self.timestamp
38
39    def add_related_error(self, error_id: str) -> None:
40        """Add related error ID."""
41        if error_id not in self.related_errors:
42            self.related_errors.append(error_id)

PerformanceMetrics¶

Performance metrics for interfaces.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class PerformanceMetrics:
 3    """Performance metrics for interfaces."""
 4
 5    # Timing metrics
 6    latency_min: float = float('inf')
 7    latency_max: float = 0.0
 8    latency_avg: float = 0.0
 9    latency_p95: float = 0.0
10    latency_p99: float = 0.0
11
12    # Throughput metrics
13    messages_per_second: float = 0.0
14    bytes_per_second: float = 0.0
15    operations_per_second: float = 0.0
16
17    # Reliability metrics
18    success_rate: float = 0.0
19    error_rate: float = 0.0
20    timeout_rate: float = 0.0
21    retry_rate: float = 0.0
22
23    # Resource metrics
24    cpu_usage: float = 0.0
25    memory_usage: float = 0.0
26    network_usage: float = 0.0
27    connection_count: int = 0
28
29    # Queue metrics
30    queue_depth: int = 0
31    queue_latency: float = 0.0
32    dropped_messages: int = 0
33    backpressure_events: int = 0
34
35    # Time window
36    measurement_start: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
37    measurement_end: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
38    sample_count: int = 0
39
40    @property
41    def measurement_duration(self) -> float:
42        """Get measurement duration in seconds."""
43        return self.measurement_end - self.measurement_start
44
45    def update_latency(self, latency: float) -> None:
46        """Update latency metrics with new sample."""
47        self.latency_min = min(self.latency_min, latency)
48        self.latency_max = max(self.latency_max, latency)
49
50        # Update running average
51        self.latency_avg = ((self.latency_avg * self.sample_count + latency) /
52                           (self.sample_count + 1))
53        self.sample_count += 1

Methods (2)¶

measurement_duration(self)¶

Get measurement duration in seconds.

update_latency(self, latency)¶

Update latency metrics with new sample.

CommunicationStats¶

Comprehensive communication statistics.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class CommunicationStats:
 3    """Comprehensive communication statistics."""
 4
 5    # Basic counters
 6    total_connections: int = 0
 7    active_connections: int = 0
 8    failed_connections: int = 0
 9
10    # Message counters
11    messages_sent: int = 0
12    messages_received: int = 0
13    messages_dropped: int = 0
14    messages_retried: int = 0
15
16    # Byte counters
17    bytes_sent: int = 0
18    bytes_received: int = 0
19
20    # Error counters
21    connection_errors: int = 0
22    timeout_errors: int = 0
23    serialization_errors: int = 0
24    protocol_errors: int = 0
25
26    # Performance metrics
27    performance: PerformanceMetrics = field(default_factory=PerformanceMetrics)
28
29    # Historical data
30    hourly_stats: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
31    daily_stats: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
32
33    # Status tracking
34    last_reset: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
35    last_update: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
36
37    def reset_counters(self) -> None:
38        """Reset all counters."""
39        self.total_connections = 0
40        self.active_connections = 0
41        self.failed_connections = 0
42        self.messages_sent = 0
43        self.messages_received = 0
44        self.messages_dropped = 0
45        self.messages_retried = 0
46        self.bytes_sent = 0
47        self.bytes_received = 0
48        self.connection_errors = 0
49        self.timeout_errors = 0
50        self.serialization_errors = 0
51        self.protocol_errors = 0
52        self.last_reset = time.time()
53
54    def update_timestamp(self) -> None:
55        """Update last update timestamp."""
56        self.last_update = time.time()
57
58    @property
59    def uptime(self) -> float:
60        """Get uptime since last reset in seconds."""
61        return time.time() - self.last_reset

QueueConfig¶

Configuration for message queues.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class QueueConfig:
 3    """Configuration for message queues."""
 4
 5    # Queue properties
 6    max_size: int = 1000
 7    timeout: float = 30.0
 8    priority_enabled: bool = False
 9
10    # Overflow behavior
11    overflow_strategy: str = "drop_oldest"  # drop_oldest, drop_newest, block, reject
12
13    # Persistence
14    persistent: bool = False
15    persistence_file: Optional[str] = None
16
17    # Monitoring
18    enable_metrics: bool = True
19    warning_threshold: float = 0.8  # Warn when queue is 80% full
20
21    # Serialization
22    serializer: str = "pickle"
23
24    def get_warning_size(self) -> int:
25        """Get queue size that triggers warning."""
26        return int(self.max_size * self.warning_threshold)

DeviceInfo¶

Device information structure.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class DeviceInfo:
 3    """Device information structure."""
 4
 5    # Device identification
 6    device_id: str = field(default_factory=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()))
 7    name: str = "unknown"
 8    manufacturer: str = "unknown"
 9    model: str = "unknown"
10    serial_number: Optional[str] = None
11    firmware_version: Optional[str] = None
12
13    # Device properties
14    device_type: str = "generic"
15    capabilities: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
16    supported_protocols: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
17
18    # Connection info
19    interface_type: InterfaceType = InterfaceType.SERIAL
20    address: Optional[str] = None
21    baudrate: Optional[int] = None
22
23    # Status
24    online: bool = False
25    last_seen: Optional[float] = None
26    health_status: str = "unknown"
27
28    # Configuration
29    config: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
30    metadata: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
31
32    @property
33    def is_online(self) -> bool:
34        """Check if device is online."""
35        return self.online
36
37    @property
38    def time_since_seen(self) -> Optional[float]:
39        """Get time since last seen in seconds."""
40        if self.last_seen is None:
41            return None
42        return time.time() - self.last_seen
43
44    def update_last_seen(self) -> None:
45        """Update last seen timestamp."""
46        self.last_seen = time.time()
47        self.online = True
